elements.title: Sjölejonet class (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Sjölejonet class (example pictured), Sweden's first indigenous submarines, featured rotating torpedo tubes and disappearing guns?

elements.title: David Avraham Voluck (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that David Avraham Voluck, a Chabad Jew and native tribal judge, credits Alaska natives with inspiring him to become more observant in his own faith?

elements.title: First Luv (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the music video for Bini's "First Luv" was inspired by rococo art?

elements.title: Tanguturi Prakasam (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Tanguturi Prakasam, a leader of the Indian independence movement, later became a significant dissenting figure within the Indian government?

elements.title: Vindelev Hoard (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the inscription on a bracteate in the Vindelev Hoard has been interpreted as the oldest known reference to the Norse god Odin?

elements.title: Miller House (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Miller House in Indiana opened to the public in 2011, drawing high visitor numbers that were likened to the opening of a new Disney ride?

elements.title: Rosa Dubovsky (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Rosa Dubovsky admonished male anarchists for misusing free love to justify promiscuity?

elements.title: Punggol LRT line (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a track-intrusion detection system was implemented on the Punggol LRT line following the death of a woman at Cove station?

elements.title: that white lady (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Thurgood Marshall, amid a Kansas desegregation case, said "god damn it give that white lady the money"?

elements.title: Destination of the Month (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:
Destination of the Month

San Carlos de Bariloche

The Argentine adventure capital offers great opportunities for skiing, sightseeing, water sports, trekking and climbing amidst the amazing mountainous landscapes of Argentine Patagonia.

elements.title: Off the Beaten Path (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:
Off the Beaten Path

Andorra la Vella

Andorra la Vella is the capital of a quirky co-principality lodged in the mountains between Spain and France that offers great skiing, hiking, and lots of duty-free shopping.

elements.title: Featured Travel Topic (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:
Featured Travel Topic

San Diego International Airport

The main airport to America's finest city is the busiest single runway airport in the world.
